page.title: 09Croal-Irwell Valley
page.content: On Friday 14th June the{warden of the{Croal-Irwell valley,}Mr. Wolstencroft, came to school to show us some slides.The slides were about the work that has been done to change this industrial valley into an area where{wildlife}is{encouraged}and protected. The{river}has been{cleaned, paths have been{built}and a{lake}which was formed by the removal of gravel, has been{landscaped. He showed us a couple of slides of {animals}that had been deliberately {killed}and on a few slides there were signs of{chemical waste.}One slide showed the river with frothy pink dye from a factory making toilet rolls. At the end he showed us some funny slides with some of his workmates stuck in funny situations.
